s.text: While Clinton won the kiddie-cash sweepstakes for the cycle, the leading contenders in the primary season were two cash-hungry Republicans: Texas Sen.
(That election was a high-water mark for student donations in a nonpresidential year--twice the level of the 1989-90 campaigns.)
Another big Democratic money raiser, Howard Glicken, also was helped by his sons.
The Branson kids, Buck, Frank L. IV, and Jennifer, were listed as students on $10,000 worth of FEC filings, donations that added to their trial-lawyer parents' $175,304.
In every case where I was able to establish a parent-child relationship, minors gave to exactly the same campaigns as their parents, almost always on the same day.
